info.title: DRES API
info.description: API for DRES (Distributed Retrieval Evaluation Server), Version 2.0.0

get.summary: Lists all audit logs matching the query.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results. Default: 500

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page index offset, relative to the limit.

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user starts the call

get.summary: Lists all audit logs matching the query

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Timestamp of the earliest audit log to include

parameters.name: upto
parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest audit log to include.

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user starts the call

post.summary: Adds a new media collection.
Adds a media item to the specified media collection.

delete.summary: Deletes a media collection identified by a collection id.

get.summary: Shows the content of the specified media collection.

delete.summary: Tries to delete a specific media item.

get.summary: Selects and returns a specific media item.
Lists all available media collections with basic information about their content.
Lists items from the external media collection whose name start with the given string.
Lists media items from a given media collection whose name start with the given string.

parameters.name: startsWith
parameters.description: Name the item(s) should start with.

get.summary: Selects and returns a random media item from a given media collection.

post.summary: Resolves a list of media item names to media items

patch.summary: Updates a Media Item to the specified Media Collection.

get.summary: Provides a JSON download of the entire evaluation  structure.
Provides a JSON download of the entire evaluation template structure.
Provides a CSV download with the scores for a given evaluation.

post.summary: Adjusts the duration of a running task. This is a method for admins.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration to add. Can be negative.

patch.summary: Changes the properties of an evaluation.

post.summary: Creates a new evaluation run from an existing evaluation template. This is a method for administrators.

get.summary: Provides a complete overview of a run.

post.summary: Forces a viewer with the given viewer ID into the READY state. This is a method for admins.

get.summary: Lists all past tasks for a given evaluation.
Lists all submissions for a given evaluation and task.
Lists all registered viewers for a evaluation. This is a method for admins.

post.summary: Moves to and selects the next task within the evaluation. This is a method for admins.

patch.summary: Override the submission status for a given submission.

post.summary: Moves to and selects the previous task. This is a method for admins.
Starts a evaluation. This is a method for administrators.
Starts the currently active task as a new task run. This is a method for admins.
Terminates an evaluation. This is a method for administrators.
Aborts the currently running task run. This is a method for admins.
Moves to and selects the specified task. This is a method for admins.

parameters.name: idx
parameters.description: Index of the task to switch to.

get.summary: Lists an overview of all evaluation runs visible to the current client.
Returns an overview of the currently active task for a run.
Returns the overviews of all score boards for the current task, if it is either running or has just ended.
Returns the overviews of all score boards for the specified task.
Returns a list of available scoreboard names for the given evaluation.
Returns a time series for a given run and scoreboard.

parameters.name: scoreboard
parameters.description: Name of the scoreboard to return the time series for.

get.summary: Returns team group aggregated values of the current task.
Returns the information for the currently active task template (i.e., the one that is currently selected).
Returns basic information about a specific evaluation.
Returns the state of a specific evaluation.
Returns all submissions for the current task that are more recent than the provided timestamp, if a task is either running or has just ended.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp that marks the lower bound for returned submissions.

get.summary: Returns the submissions of a specific task run, regardless of whether it is currently running or has ended.
Returns all submissions for the current task run, if one is either running or has just ended.
Returns the task target for the current task run (i.e. the one that is currently selected).
Lists an overview of all evaluations visible to the current user.
Lists an overview of all evaluation visible to the current user.
Gets the next open submission that is waiting to be judged.
Gets the next open submission that is waiting to be voted on.
Retrieves the status of all judgement validators.

post.summary: Endpoint to post a judgement for a previously detached judgement request.

408.description: On timeout: Judgement took too long

post.summary: Returns a Vote.
Accepts query logs from participants
Accepts result logs from participants.

get.summary: Returns the score overviews of a specific evaluation run.

post.summary: Endpoint to accept batch submissions in JSON format

get.summary: Endpoint to accept submissions

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Collection identifier. Optional, in which case the default collection for the run will be considered.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Identifier for the actual media object or media file.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to be submitted. ONLY for tasks with target type TEXT. If this parameter is provided, it superseeds all athers.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Frame number for media with temporal progression (e.g., video).

parameters.name: shot
parameters.description: Shot number for media with temporal progression (e.g., video).

parameters.name: timecode
parameters.description: Timecode for media with temporal progression (e.g,. video).

get.summary: Returns the current time on the server.
Returns an overview of the server properties.

post.summary: Sets roles for session based on user account and returns a session cookie.

get.summary: Clears all user roles of the current session.

post.summary: Creates a new evaluation template.

delete.summary: Deletes the evaluation template with the given template ID.

get.summary: Loads the detailed definition of a specific evaluation template.
Lists an overview of all available competitions with basic information about their content.
Lists the task templates contained in a specific evaluation template.
Lists all the teams of a specific competition.

post.summary: Creates a new user, if the username is not already taken. Requires ADMIN privileges

400.description: If the username is already taken

get.summary: Get information about the current user.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified user. Requires ADMIN privileges

404.description: If the user could not be found

patch.summary: Updates the specified user, if it exists. Anyone is allowed to update their data, however only ADMINs are allowed to update anyone.

get.summary: Gets details of the user with the given id.

404.description: If the user could not be found.

get.summary: Get details of all current user sessions
Lists all available users.
Get current sessionId
Gives information about the audit log. Namely size and latest timestamp of known entries.

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user executes the call.

get.summary: Returns the task hint for the specified task.
